paper_abstract: A novel ROI-based reversible data hiding scheme is proposed for medical images, which is able to hide electronic patient record (EPR) and protect the region of interest (ROI) with tamper localization and recovery. The proposed scheme combines prediction error expansion with the sorting technique for embedding EPR into ROI, and the recovery information is embedded into the region of non-interest (RONI) using histogram shifting (HS) method which hardly leads to the overflow and underflow problems. The experimental results show that the proposed scheme not only can embed a large amount of information with low distortion, but also can localize and recover the tampered area inside ROI.
paper_title: ROI-Based Reversible Data Hiding Scheme for Medical Images with Tamper Detection
